Data Structures | Macros | Enumerations | Functions | Variables
I2S - Inter-IC Sound
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides functions for configuring, controlling, and managing the Inter-IC Sound (I2S) peripheral on Apollo5 devices. It supports audio data transfer, clock configuration, DMA, and interrupt handling for digital audio applications.

Key Features

  1. Audio Data Transmission: Support for I2S audio data transfer.
  2. DMA Support: High-speed DMA-based audio streaming.
  3. Clock Configuration: Flexible clock source and divider settings.
  4. Format Support: Multiple I2S data formats and word lengths.
  5. Interrupt Handling: Comprehensive interrupt management for I2S events.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure the I2S peripheral
  • Set up audio data transmission and reception
  • Configure and manage DMA transfers for audio streaming
  • Handle I2S interrupts and status monitoring
  • Support for various I2S data formats and clocking options

Usage

  1. Initialize I2S using am_hal_i2s_initialize()
  2. Configure I2S parameters and clock settings
  3. Set up DMA or interrupt-driven audio streaming
  4. Start and stop audio data transfer as needed
  5. Handle I2S events and monitor status

Configuration

  • Clock Source: Select and configure I2S clock source
  • Data Format: Set up I2S data format and word length
  • DMA Settings: Configure DMA transfer parameters
  • Interrupts: Set up interrupt sources and handlers

Macro Definition Documentation

◆ AM_HAL_I2S_CH_NUM_FOR_MONO

#define AM_HAL_I2S_CH_NUM_FOR_MONO   (1)

For I2S mono mode, we can define AM_HAL_I2S_CH_NUM_FOR_MONO as 2 to set 2 channels, one channel for mono audio data transfer, the other one is unused. We can also define AM_HAL_I2S_CH_NUM_FOR_MONO as 1 to set only 1 channel for the mono audio data transfer.

◆ I2Sn

#define I2Sn ( n)    ((I2S0_Type*)(AM_REG_I2Sn(n)))

CMSIS-style macro for handling a variable I2S module number.

◆ USE_I2S_TWO_STAGE_DMA

#define USE_I2S_TWO_STAGE_DMA

Enable the two-stage DMA request pipeline feature.

This feature is added to ease SW ISR latency requirement to reload next DMA request when the current DMA request is completed.

To disable the 2-stage DMA feature, undefine this macro. The user needs to ensure that the response time of the DMACPL ISR is less than the time it takes for the I2S FIFO (typically with a size of 64 words) to become filled, or else data loss may occur.

To enable the 2-stage DMA feature, define ths macro. The user has a longer response time for the DMACPL ISR, which is approximately equal to the time it takes to fill the entire DMA buffer.

◆ am_hal_i2s_clk_div_e

enum am_hal_i2s_clk_div_e

enumeration types for the I2S clock selection.

Enumerator
AM_HAL_I2S_CLKDIV_1 

no change to the clock selected by FSEL.

AM_HAL_I2S_CLKDIV_3 

frequency divide-by-3 of the clock selected by FSEL.

◆ am_hal_i2s_clksel_e

enum am_hal_i2s_clksel_e

Clock source of I2S module clock.

Enumerator
AM_HAL_I2S_CLKSEL_HFRC_48MHz 

HFRC 48 MHz, the actual frequency may change if HFADJ is enabled.

AM_HAL_I2S_CLKSEL_XTHS 

External crystal oscillator.

AM_HAL_I2S_CLKSEL_PLL_POSTDIV 

POSTDIV, an output of PLL.

AM_HAL_I2S_CLKSEL_PLL_FOUT3 

FOUT3, an output of PLL, its frequency is equal to POSTDIV / 6.

AM_HAL_I2S_CLKSEL_PLL_FOUT4 

FOUT4, an output of PLL, its frequency is equal to POSTDIV / 8.

AM_HAL_I2S_CLKSEL_EXTREF 

External clock from GPIO 15.

AM_HAL_I2S_CLKSEL_NCO_HFRC_96MHz 

HFRC 96 MHz through NCO circuitry, the actual frequency may change if HFADJ is enabled.

AM_HAL_I2S_CLKSEL_NCO_XTHS 

External crystal oscillator through NCO circuitry.

AM_HAL_I2S_CLKSEL_NCO_PLL_POSTDIV 

PLL POSTDIV through NCO circuitry.

AM_HAL_I2S_CLKSEL_NCO_EXTREF 

External clock from GPIO 15 through NCO circuitry.

AM_HAL_I2S_CLKSEL_OFF 

A virtual clock for internal use only, shouldn't be set by applications.

enum am_hal_i2s_data_justified_e

Audio sample justification. 0: Left-justified, 1: Right-justified.

AM_HAL_I2S_DATA_JUSTIFIED_LEFT 
AM_HAL_I2S_DATA_JUSTIFIED_RIGHT 

◆ am_hal_i2s_data_phase_e

enum am_hal_i2s_data_phase_e

Specifies the data format of I2S sub frames I2SDATACFG @0x00000040

Read Phase Bit. 0: Single Phase frame; 1: Dual-Phase frame.

Enumerator
AM_HAL_I2S_DATA_PHASE_SINGLE 
AM_HAL_I2S_DATA_PHASE_DUAL 

◆ am_hal_i2s_fsync_pulse_type_e

enum am_hal_i2s_fsync_pulse_type_e

The pulse type of the frame sync signal.

Enumerator
AM_HAL_I2S_FSYNC_PULSE_ONE_SUBFRAME 

The pulse width is euqal to the word width of the first channel.

AM_HAL_I2S_FSYNC_PULSE_ONE_BIT_CLOCK 

The pulse width is euqal to one bit clock.

AM_HAL_I2S_FSYNC_PULSE_HALF_FRAME_PERIOD 

The pulse width is euqal to 50% of the frame period.

AM_HAL_I2S_FSYNC_PULSE_CUSTOM 

The pulse width is defined by the user.

◆ am_hal_i2s_dma_configure()

uint32_t am_hal_i2s_dma_configure ( void * pHandle,
am_hal_i2s_config_t * psConfig,
am_hal_i2s_transfer_t * pTransferCfg )

I2S DMA Transaction Configuration.

Gets the DMA status(TXMDASTAT/RXDMASTAT)

Parameters
pHandle- handle for the interface.
psConfig- Pointer to the I2S Config
pTransferCfg- Pointer to the I2S Transaction Config
Note
If the data cache is enabled, ensure that the starting address of the DMA buffer is aligned to 32 bytes to meet the requirements of cache operations.
If the data cache is enabled, the flushing of the TX DMA buffer should be handled by the user in their application code, the invalidation of the RX DMA buffer is handled by the HAL in the am_hal_i2s_dma_get_buffer() function.
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS

◆ am_hal_i2s_ipb_interrupt_service()

uint32_t am_hal_i2s_ipb_interrupt_service ( void * pHandle)

I2S IPB Interrupt Service Routine.

This function is currently called internal to am_hal_i2s_interrupt_service IRB -> full-duplex I2S (stereo TX + stereo RX) using shared CLK & FS

Parameters
pHandle- handle for the module instance.
ui32IntMask- uint32_t for interrupts to clear
psConfig- Pointer to the I2S Config
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS
